bibl.title: Henry Carlton v. William Cochrane. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: In the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, King County, Wash. Ter.
In the matter of the application of No.5930 Henry Carlton Petition for Writ of Habeas For a Writ of Habeas Corpus Corpus
To the Hon. Richard A. Jones, Chief of Justice for the Supreme Court and sole presiding Judge of the said District Court:

Your petitioner, Henry Carlton, states that he is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by William Cochrane, Sheriff of the County of King, in Washington Territory, at the County Jail in the City of Seattle in said County.
That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint are illegal.

That the cause and pretense of said restraint, imprisonment, confinement and detention is a paper writing purporting to be a commitment from N. Soderberg, Justice of the Peace for Seattle, Precinct; King County, Washington Territory.

That the illegality of said restraint, imprisonment, detention and confinement in this: That the said paper writing is not a commitment in this: That it does not show that said Defendant has been convicted of any offense, or that the Court issuing said paper writing had any jurisdiction to commit said petitioner: and that said paper writing is not a commitment, but is void and of no effect whatever, and that said Sheriff has no right or authority to detain said Petitioner thereon:
That a copy of said paper writing, alleged to be a commitment, is filed herewith as a part hereof, and marked "Exhibit A."
WHEREFORE Petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus directed
to said Sheriff may issue in this behalf, and that your Petitioner may be forthwith brought before your Honor to do, submit for and receive what the law may require.
Territory of Washington County of King
Henry Carlton, your Affiant says: I am the Petitioner above named. That I have read the foregoing petition, and know its contents, and that the same is true
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 27th day of April, 1888 Junius Rochester Notary Public in and for Washington Territory
In the matter of the application of Henry Carlton for Writ of Habeas Corpus
